articles.title: WHAT'S GOING ON IN THE CLUB:
articles.summary: This astronomy club bulletin outlines a series of upcoming events for May, June, and July, featuring multiple star parties at locations like Big Bear, Fremont Peak, and El Sereno. These gatherings offer opportunities to observe celestial objects, with large aperture telescopes highlighted at Fremont Peak. The club also schedules its annual board election meeting, a regular board meeting, and a banquet, with some event locations yet to be determined.

articles.title: Editor's Note:
articles.summary: This Editor's Note announces that Rattley, a regular contributor, will not be featured this month. He is currently engaged in a special, technical project involving equations and computer time, which many long-standing members may recognize. Readers can expect more information about this project in the next issue.

articles.title: Ads Infinitum:
articles.summary: The article's "Ads Infinitum" section features two primary classifieds: one offering a 6-inch Edmund f/8 reflector telescope with various accessories and publications for sale, and another seeking passengers to share the cost of a private plane trip to an ATM conference in Riverside. It also includes a hand-drawn map for directions and introduces a "Tech Talk" column by Don McGlauflin featuring contributions from club members.

articles.title: FORMULA FOR MINOR AXIS SIZE OF DIAGONAL
articles.summary: This document features a technical article by Norman Wild providing a formula for calculating the minor axis size of a diagonal mirror in a reflector telescope, considering variables such as tube diameter, focusing mount height, and desired image illumination for various observational purposes. Additionally, it includes an update on Joe Perry's ongoing 32-inch telescope project, nearing completion, and announces a list of mirrors for sale. The document also teases an upcoming article on an off-axis guider.
